name: Trouvez des offres d'embauche sur Threads avec Apify, filtrage AI et alertes Telegram
description:
Scrapez automatiquement Meta Threads pour des publications recrutant des rôles spécifiques (par exemple, ingénieurs en automatisation, monteurs vidéo, graphistes), filtrez l'intention réelle d'embauche, dédupliquez et envoyez des alertes.

Nous prenons les rôles d'automatisation comme exemple pour l'instant.

## Ce que cela fait

Ce flux de travail scanne en continu Threads à la recherche de nouvelles publications mentionnant les rôles qui vous intéressent. Il utilise l'IA pour filtrer l'auto-promotion et les annonces de services, ne conservant que les publications où l'auteur recrute. Les publications qualifiées sont enregistrées dans Google Sheets pour le suivi et envoyées à Telegram pour des alertes instantanées.

C'est idéal pour les freelances, les agences et les chercheurs d'emploi qui souhaitent un radar constant d'opportunités.

## Comment cela fonctionne (Étape par Étape)

1. **Déclencheur de planification** – S'exécute à un intervalle défini (par exemple, toutes les 12 heures).

2. **Scraper les publications Threads** – Récupère les publications récentes à partir de plusieurs mots-clés (par exemple, “expert n8n”, “embaucher un monteur vidéo”, “graphiste”, etc.) via Apify.

3. **Fusionner les résultats** – Combine les publications en un seul flux.

4. **Normaliser les champs** – Mappe les données brutes dans des champs propres : texte, auteur, URL, horodatage, lien de profil.

5. **Filtre AI** – Utilise un agent AI pour :

- Accepter uniquement les publications où quelqu'un recrute (rejette les auto-promotions de type “embauchez-moi”).
- Appliquer des règles géographiques simples (par exemple, autoriser les États-Unis, le Royaume-Uni, les Émirats Arabes Unis, le Canada ; passer les inconnus).
- Exclure les rôles en dehors de votre champ d'application.
- Dé-duplication – Vérifie Google Sheets pour ignorer les publications déjà vues.

6. **Enregistrer dans Google Sheets** – Écrit les publications qualifiées avec tous les détails.

7. **Alertes Telegram** – Vous envoie la publication correspondante instantanément afin que vous puissiez agir.

## **Pour qui c'est**

**Freelances :** Obtenez les premières opportunités avant que d'autres ne les repèrent.

**Agences :** Construisez un pipeline de clients en suivant les signaux d'embauche.

**Chercheurs d'emploi :** Repérez des opportunités cachées dans votre domaine cible.

## Idées de personnalisation

Échangez des mots-clés pour surveiller les rôles qui vous intéressent (par exemple, “designer UI/UX”, “monteur de graphiques animés”, “rédacteur”).

Ajoutez des notifications Slack ou Discord au lieu de Telegram.

Élargissez les règles géographiques pour correspondre à votre région.

Utilisez Sheets comme un CRM—ajoutez des colonnes pour le statut, la date de contact, etc.

parameters.text: =This is the text that you have to check  {{ $json.text_content }}{{ $json.created_at }}{{ $json.username }}{{ $json.profile_url }}{{ $json.post_url }}

options.systemMessage:
=<goal> You are Hiring Post Classifier & Extractor. Read short social posts and return only posts where the author is hiring an n8n automation engineer in allowed geographies. Deduplicate against Google Sheets before output. If non-passing or duplicate → output nothing. </goal>

<format_rules>
Input (exact shape) is provided as:
{
"text_content": "{{ $json.text_content }}",
"created_at": "{{ $json.created_at }}",
"post_url": "{{ $json.post_url }}",
"username": "{{ $json.username }}",
"profile_url": "{{ $json.profile_url }}"
}

Output: strict JSON in the same shape (see <output>), or no output (empty response) if rejected/duplicate.

No extra fields, no prose, no arrays, no explanations.
</format_rules>

<restrictions> - No separate bio/location field exists. Infer geography **only from `text_content`** (explicit city/country names found there). - If no location signal appears → treat as **unknown** and **allow** geo rule to pass. - Never fabricate locations. If ambiguous (e.g., “Birmingham”), **do not assume**. </restrictions>

<geo_rules>
Allowed countries (normalized): ["US","UK","UAE","CA"]

Aliases:
US → ["US","USA","United States"]
UK → ["UK","United Kingdom","England","Scotland","Wales","Northern Ireland"]
UAE → ["UAE","United Arab Emirates"]
CA → ["CA","Canada"]

Strong city→country inference (examples):
US: NYC/New York, Los Angeles/LA, Austin, SF/San Francisco, Chicago
UK: London, Manchester, Bristol, Leeds
UAE: Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Sharjah
CA: Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal, Calgary, Ottawa
</geo_rules>

<decision_rules>
Hire-only (author as hirer; no replies/retweets unless restated by author as hirer).
Accept if text clearly signals an open n8n automation engineer role.
Strong cues (any): hiring, we’re hiring, hiring:, opening, role, position, join our team, bring on an n8n engineer, seeking an n8n automation engineer, need an automation engineer (n8n), apply, send your portfolio/resume, email to, link to job.
Helpful (not required): full-time, part-time, contract, paid, salary, compensation.

Role scope:
Accept when automation duties are explicit with n8n (e.g., n8n engineer, n8n workflow engineer, AI automation engineer with n8n, workflow/no-code/low-code automation engineer mentioning n8n).
Exclude generic software/IT roles without n8n, RPA-only with no n8n mention, “consultant available” posts, and unrelated roles (e.g., videographer, designer).

Exclude self-promotion/service ads/bait.
Reject if the author markets themselves/services (e.g., “hire me,” “available for automation projects,” “my rates,” “portfolio,” “book me,” “services,” “I build automations for you”).
If the author appears to be a freelancer for hire and the post is ambiguous → treat as self-promo → exclude.

Geography filter.

Explicit location outside allowed set → exclude.

Explicit allowed country/city or strong city signal → pass.

No location present → pass (unknown).

Multiple locations → pass if any are allowed.

Deduplication via Google Sheets.
After passing 1–3, query the sheet for post_url. If found → output nothing. If not found → proceed to output.
</decision_rules>

<tools_and_usage>
<google_sheets access="read-only">
method: find(post_url) → returns match if post_url already exists
</google_sheets>
</tools_and_usage>

<planning_guidance>
Validate hire intent (author hiring an n8n automation engineer) and exclude replies/retweets unless author restates as hirer.
Screen out self-promo/service ads.
Apply geo rules using only text_content.
If pass, call Google Sheets to check post_url.
If duplicate → no output.
If unique → emit strict JSON (exact fields only).
</planning_guidance>

<output> For passing, non-duplicate posts, return **only**: { "text_content": "{{ $json.text_content }}", "created_at": "{{ $json.created_at }}", "post_url": "{{ $json.post_url }}", "username": "{{ $json.username }}", "profile_url": "{{ $json.profile_url }}" } Otherwise, **return nothing**. </output>

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet
Get row(s) in sheet in Google Sheets

parameters.text:
=Post (using to match): {{ $json.text_content }},   
Created at: {{ $json.created_at }},   
Author: {{ $json.username }},   
Post URL: {{ $json.post_url }},   
Profile URL: {{ $json.profile_url }}

parameters.content:
Automatically scrape Meta Threads for posts hiring specific roles (e.g. automation engineers, video editors, graphic designers), filter true hiring intent, deduplicate, and send alerts.

We are taking automation roles as an example for now.

## What it does

This workflow continuously scans Threads for fresh posts mentioning the roles you care about. It uses AI to filter out self-promotion and service ads, keeping only posts where the author is hiring. Qualified posts are saved into Google Sheets for tracking and sent to Telegram for instant alerts.

It’s ideal for freelancers, agencies, and job seekers who want a steady radar of opportunities.

## How it works (Step by Step)

1. **Schedule trigger** – Runs on a set interval (e.g. every 12 hours).

2. **Scrape Threads posts** – Fetches recent posts from multiple keywords (e.g., “n8n expert”, “hire video editor”, “graphic designer”, etc.) via Apify.

3. **Merge results** – Combines posts into a single stream.

4. **Normalize fields** – Maps raw data into clean fields: text, author, URL, timestamp, profile link.

5. **AI filter** – Uses an AI Agent to:

- Accept only posts where someone is hiring (rejects “hire me” style self-promo).
- Apply simple geography rules (e.g., allow US, UK, UAE, CA; pass unknowns).
- Exclude roles outside your scope.
- Deduplication – Checks Google Sheets to skip posts already seen.

6. **Save to Google Sheets** – Writes qualified posts with full details.

7. **Telegram alerts** – Sends you the matched post instantly so you can act.

## **Who it’s for**

**Freelancers:** Get first dibs on gigs before others spot them.

**Agencies:** Build a client pipeline by tracking hiring signals.

**Job seekers:** Spot hidden opportunities in your target field.

## Customization Ideas

Swap keywords to monitor roles you care about (e.g., “UI/UX designer”, “motion graphics editor”, “copywriter”).

Add Slack or Discord notifications instead of Telegram.

Expand geo rules to match your region.

Use Sheets as a CRM—add columns for status, outreach date, etc

# Looking for tailored workflows? Book through my Reddit or website—and follow for future templates.
## Reddit: https://www.reddit.com/user/designbyaze/
## Website: https://hushtech.io/

## 1. Replace the API keys in each Https node
## 2. Add the specified role in the json part 
## 3, The apify actor used: https://apify.com/futurizerush/meta-threads-scraper

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
